subject: RE: [junit] Loader constraints
msgSnippet: Follow up to Scott s questions: Is one or more jars on your classpath sealed? =jason On Wed, 2003-03-05 at 18:51, Scott Stirling wrote:  From: Patricia
messageBody:
Follow up to Scott's questions: Is one or more jars on your classpath
sealed?

=jason

On Wed, 2003-03-05 at 18:51, Scott Stirling wrote: > From: Patricia
[mailto:patryf@...]
>
> I'm running my testcases using JUnit and I'm getting the following
> error
> java.lang.LinkageError: Class junit/framework/TestResult violates
> loader constraints: parent and child already loaded different classes
>
> I did a search in this group and I did not find a questions similar
> to this problem.

I'd be interested to know how you managed this. A LinkageError is a
pretty
rare error in most Java circles, and disproportionately common in JUnit
circles under the right/wrong conditions. And loader constraints are
ClassLoader architecture esoterica so abstruse that it seems silly to
even
mention them in the error message.

This FAQ entry deals with the most common LinkageError problem we see:
http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#running_9

But yours is interesting because somehow you've wound up loading one of
the
core JUnit classes in two different classloaders. So, I really have to
ask,
how are you running JUnit? Is it in an IDE, from the command line, in
Ant,
in some kind app server container, or what? What does your classpath
and
command line look like? And do you have an excluded.properties outside
the
one in junit.jar? If so, what are it's contents? Any other info you
think
might be relevant would be helpful. This is a pretty unusual scenario
you've discovered.

Scott Stirling
